Class Map

Map
public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
this is the major class that hold the information of map

    Constructors

    • Map

      public Map()

  • Method Details

    • play

      public boolean play​(Player player, int row, int column)
      this method control other blocks
      Parameters:
      player - player to play
      row - the entered row
      column - the entered column
      Returns:
      true if he entered a valid block and false if not

    • validBlock

      public void validBlock​(Player player)
      this method get the player and save the block that it can place his disk.
      Parameters:
      player - player to check

    • checkAround

      public boolean checkAround​(int i, int j, int colorCode)
      this method get an specific block and check all around it.
      Parameters:
      i - row number of block
      j - column number of block
      colorCode - the color to check
      Returns:
      true if that block is valid or false if not

    • checkDirection

      public boolean checkDirection​(int k, int l, int i, int j, int colorCode)
      this method get a block and two parameter to check an specific direction around it
      Parameters:
      k - its added to make new row
      l - its added to make new column
      i - row of block
      j - column of block
      colorCode - color to check
      Returns:
      true if it is possible and false if not.

    • isInMap

      public boolean isInMap​(int i, int j)
      this method check that if the block [i][j] is in our map or not
      Parameters:
      i - row
      j - column
      Returns:
      true if in map and false if not

    • reverseAround

      public void reverseAround​(int colorCode, int i, int j)
      reverse all disks that has the condition
      Parameters:
      colorCode - color code of putted disk
      i - row number of putted disk
      j - column number of putted disk

    • reverseDirection

      public void reverseDirection​(int k, int l, int i, int j, int colorCode)
      reverse disks in an specific direction
      Parameters:
      k - its added to make new row
      l - its added to makes new column
      i - row number of putted disk
      j - column number of putted disk
      colorCode - color code of putted disk

    • hasValid

      public boolean hasValid​(Player player)
      check if the player can put any disk or not
      Parameters:
      player - player to check
      Returns:
      true if he can and false if he cant

    • countColor

      public int countColor​(Player player)
      count disks of player in the map
      Parameters:
      player - player to count
      Returns:
      number of his disk

    • print

      public void print​(Player p1, Player p2)
      print the map and number of each persons disk we save three number 0, 1, 2 in map, but in printing use unicode
      Parameters:
      p1 - first player
      p2 - second player
